text: Carys Creek is a long tributary to the Little Nottoway River in the United States state of Virginia. Located in the south-central part of the state, it is part of the larger Chowan-Albemarle drainage. The watershed is 74% forested and 25% agricultural with the rest of land as other uses. This stream joins with Carys Creek to form the Little Nottoway River. ==References== Category:Rivers of Virginia Category:Tributaries of Albemarle Sound
title: Carys Creek (Little Nottoway River tributary)
